comment: Dr. Keyser is a wonderful professor who teaches ISYE 3407 well. He is not a tough grader and has great lectures. There are two tests (one midterm and one final), but the final is over a book rather than course content. There is also a project, but it is fairly straight forward. Overall great class and great professor.

Dr. Keyser is a great professor who often brings his own experience from the working world into his classes. Everything taught is applicable to real life. There is a midterm exam and final exam based on what is taught, they're fairly easy. Also expect a project in which you have more than enough time to do. Great class, great professor.

I took Dr. Keyser for ISYE 4425 & 3450. He is super caring and understanding. If something comes up, he will give you the chance to redo it (with justification). He posts his PowerPoints. He also records his examples, that are beneficial on the hws.

Professor Keyser is the best! His class was so fun and you could tell how much he cares about his students. Even after taking class with him we kept up and he even nominated me for some student awards. He genuinely wants to invest in you and help you learn. Class was easy you just need to pay attention to the lectures to be able to do the models.

Dr. Keyser is one of the best professors in the ISYE department at KSU. Take his classes when you get a chance because he truly cares about students and wants them to be successful. He is very organized, approachable, smart, and friendly. You won't regret to take his classes.
Great professor. Help students outside of class. Care of the materials. Recommend to take his class. He will be more helpful.
easy class with similar questions and practice online. Teacher was ok but looked like he didn't care for the class too much.

Very easy class to self-learn. Professor Keyser was ok but very slow. Originally attended classes when he said participation matters but that ended up being more towards persuasion to attend class. Read the lecture, write the formulas, pass.
Best University level Professor I have ever had. Every class possible, I take with Dr. Keyser.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: He is sooo nice. He takes attendance but it is only for your benefit at the end of the year. Usually an assignment each week and 3 online tests. Lectures are a little boring but informational. You will also have a prerecorded lecture and reading to do as well. Do not buy the book until he confirms you need it.

Wears his heart on his sleeve for his students. You will work hard because you want to for this guy. We  solved real world IE problems with real companies and I don't think I've gotten better experience from a class. Enjoyed learning to use Arena with him. Best professor I've ever had. Learn from his personality and carry it with you in life.

Professor Keyser is a great teacher in the IET program.  He really takes the time to explain the material completely, and gets you excited about graduating and using these tools in your job!  He is also very fair on grading and will listen well to you as a student.  I look forward to taking another one of Prof Keyser's classes!

Seriously one of the nicest human beings I have ever met. He is also an incredible teacher and genuinely cares about his students. I was lucky enough to have him as an adviser. Take any class that you can with him. Go to class and participate. He wants you to learn and encourages you even if the subject isn't the easiest. He IS the best professor.

This class can be either you get it or you don't, and it all falls on the student.  He explains the material extremely well.  Awesome professor and is always helpful.  If you do the HW, take good notes, & ask him questions you will do fine.  Don't be lazy in this class, or you will regret it when you take a test.

The sweetest, most caring professor of KSU in the SyIE Department. As a working engineer, all of his lectures incorporate real engineering problems. This guy is the professor of all professors. He will be missed when I graduate.

I had Intro to Statistics (IET 2227), Operation Management (IET 4151), and Operation Research (IET 4405) with Dr. Keyser and I am telling you, DON'T SKIP HIS CLASS. I learned a lot from his classes and I just realized that. When I first took him, I thought his classes were boring but I was wrong. You will remember everything he taught you everyday.

Professor Keyser is an outstanding professor, he has an undergrad, masters, and a PhD in IE, suffice to say he knows his stuff. Along with 20+ years of manufacturing experience, he was VP of a manufacturing company. This particular course was difficult, but his manufacturing knowledge made it simple, best professor I've ever had. Any class take him

He is a great professor.  Very clear and helpful.  He knows the material and is a great at teaching it.  Don't slack on the work in this class it can be very time consuming.  There is no text book or tests, only weekly assignments.  I couldn't imagine taking this class with Atkins just because of how vague the material can be.

Probably the best addition to the IET department in the last couple years. He's a very straight forward grader as well as teaching the material. Your class average is determined by 3 tests, so make sure you study. This class is considered to be one of the hardest in the IET curriculu but for me it straight forward because he is a great professor

Such a great professor. Keyser is very knowledgeable, and has lots of industry experience. He is very clear is his instructions and you know exactly what is expected out of you. Class time usually consists of going over homework, which is super helpful, and he really makes the most out of class time. Highly Recommend!!!!
Best pro!

He is a very helpful professor with much experience in manufacturing field. Most of the IET students will be working under a similar production environment doing cost reduction and continuous improvement projects, variability reports, capacity analysis, time studies etc. Good at what he teaches! Best Professor I  ever had to take!#knowshismaterial

Dr. Keyser is an excellent professor. I was one of the lucky students who were able to take IET 4422 with him rather than professor Atkins. His lectures are very interesting and helpful. This course should be taught by him permanently.

Super nice professor.  Lectures and online videos are extremely boring, it is statistics after all.  Do the homework and keep on top of the quizzes there are a lot.  Tests aren't bad. Final is optional!
